rev.comment: mv youtube deal info to 'products and services'. format reference.
rev.diff:
Line 69: Line 69:
[[Google Desktop]] is a service that brings the search engine to the local computer desktop, allowing one to search individual files, folders, and emails that reside locally on one's own PC.
[[Google Desktop]] is a service that brings the search engine to the local computer desktop, allowing one to search individual files, folders, and emails that reside locally on one's own PC.
â
[[2006]] saw the dawn of a number of new services, such as [[Google Page Creator]] (an easy to use, [[WYSIWYG]] webpage creator), [[Google Calendar]] (a shared-calendaring application), [[Google Spreadsheets]] (an application for editing of spreadsheets online), [[Google Notebook]] (a tool permitting users to clip text, images, and links from web pages while browsing, save them online, access them from any computer, and share them with others), and ''Google Apps for Your Domain'' (a combination of [[Gmail]], [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Talk]], and [[Google Page Creator]] into a single offering targeted to small businesses and educational institutions).<ref>Needleman, Rafe. "[http://reviews.zdnet.co.uk/0,39023100,39281962,00.htm Google Apps for Your Domain]." ''[[ZDNet]].'' [[August 29]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 31]], [[2006]]</ref> [[Google SketchUp]], a 3D CAD program, was also released in 2006, and was promoted as working with [[Google Earth]].
+
[[2006]] saw the dawn of a number of new services, such as [[Google Page Creator]] (an easy to use, [[WYSIWYG]] webpage creator), [[Google Calendar]] (a shared-calendaring application), [[Google Spreadsheets]] (an application for editing of spreadsheets online), [[Google Notebook]] (a tool permitting users to clip text, images, and links from web pages while browsing, save them online, access them from any computer, and share them with others), and ''Google Apps for Your Domain'' (a combination of [[Gmail]], [[Google Calendar]], [[Google Talk]], and [[Google Page Creator]] into a single offering targeted to small businesses and educational institutions).<ref>Needleman, Rafe. "[http://reviews.zdnet.co.uk/0,39023100,39281962,00.htm Google Apps for Your Domain]." ''[[ZDNet]].'' [[August 29]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 31]], [[2006]]</ref> [[Google SketchUp]], a 3D CAD program, was also released in 2006, and was promoted as working with [[Google Earth]]. [[2006]] also saw the introduction of [[Google Code]] project hosting.
â
[[2006]] also saw the introduction of [[Google Code]] project hosting.
+
On [[October 9]], [[2006]], Google announced that it would buy the popular online video site [[YouTube]] for [[United States Dollar|$]]1.65 billion.<ref>La Monica, Paul R. "[http://money.cnn.com/2006/10/09/technology/googleyoutube_deal/index.htm?cnn=yes Google to buy YouTube for $1.65 billion." ''[[CNN]].'' [[October 9]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[October 9]], [[2006]].</ref>
==Salaries==
==Salaries==
Line 111: Line 111:
In [[August]] [[2006]], Google signed a [[United States Dollar|$]]900 million deal with [[News Corporation|News Corp.'s]] Fox Interactive Media unit to provide search and advertising on [[MySpace]] and other News Corp. websites including IGN, AmericanIdol.com, Fox.com, and Rotten Tomatoes, although Fox Sports is not included as a deal already exists between News Corp. and MSN.<ref>Staff Writer. "[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/5254642.stm Google signs $900m News Corp deal]." ''[[BBC News]].'' [[August 7]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 8]], [[2006]].</ref> <ref>"[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,207370,00.html Google, News Corp. Ink Deal Over MySpace.com Ads]." ''[[Fox News]].'' [[August 8]], [[2006]].</ref>
In [[August]] [[2006]], Google signed a [[United States Dollar|$]]900 million deal with [[News Corporation|News Corp.'s]] Fox Interactive Media unit to provide search and advertising on [[MySpace]] and other News Corp. websites including IGN, AmericanIdol.com, Fox.com, and Rotten Tomatoes, although Fox Sports is not included as a deal already exists between News Corp. and MSN.<ref>Staff Writer. "[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/5254642.stm Google signs $900m News Corp deal]." ''[[BBC News]].'' [[August 7]], [[2006]]. Retrieved on [[August 8]], [[2006]].</ref> <ref>"[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,207370,00.html Google, News Corp. Ink Deal Over MySpace.com Ads]." ''[[Fox News]].'' [[August 8]], [[2006]].</ref>
â   â
On [[October 9]], [[2006]], it was officially announced that Google would buy YouTube for $1.65 billion. [http://money.cnn.com/2006/10/09/technology/googleyoutube_deal/index.htm?cnn=yes][http://today.reuters.com/news/articleinvesting.aspx?type=mergersNews&storyID=2006-10-09T201533Z_01_WEN6659_RTRIDST_0_MEDIA-YOUTUBE-GOOGLE-URGENT.XML]
